embeds.title: Bring It On
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :e_champ: / The Champ

Gain 9 (12) **Block:p_block:**.
Gain 9 (12) **Counter:p_counter:.**
**:finisher:**   **Finisher**

messages.content: ah yes
the 7842'th card thats just a better block
well it's a finisher
and it's the finisher that most other finishers are compared to
i played champ like 3 times and i quirkly learned this card was broken af
that or defensive mode exit bonus is
probably a combination of defensive mode exit bonus + this card's high value
i never play anyone besides automaton
because i cant learn the gimicks
probably dont participate in this discussion then
bruh
Good to know that my feeling that this card should be nerfed was correct.
perhaps 7 and 7?
can i compare this to dash
honestly maybe defensive exit bonus should be nerfed
but 9/9 is pretty ridiculous for 1 cost anyway
yeah
it's like gluing together a leap and a delayed strike+
which only Auto can do

As long as your deck can reliably get into a stance, this is a fantastic pickup, close to a non-exhausting impervious if in defensive, and a source of scaling and mitigation together if in offensive. The counter is pretty much gravy as far as I'm concerned. The major downside is that it does nothing if your not in any stance, but most of the champs cards are so focused on rewarding stances that you will often have plenty of cards to largely mitigate that downside.
Both Counter and Finisher make numbers tricky, I will probably reduce it to 8/8 (10/10) and just leave it until **Counter** gets reworked to be more interesting to use.
remember the days when this card was 10/10 (13/13)
because I certainly do
I agree, I also want to change Berserker Finisher to be just give some Vigor, as I prefer to move scaling to cards.
that sounds interesting
I'm surprised the nuclear option hasn't been done yet
Wdym by that?
I've heard you talk about changing berserker stance skill bonus to temp strength
as a nuclear option

Well, there are many ideas related to what to do with Champ, even when talking about reworking **Counter** we had multiple designs and they mostly had weird interactions with debuffs.
 Generally currently Champ has a lot of cards that want something that get pretty hard to fulfill, as they are also somewhat contradictory.
how so?
like I actually don't know how they are contradictory
~~unless this is a symptom of watcher syndrome~~

In different words, a good portion of Champ cards suffer from that they want you to do something else, so:
 Stance entries - want you to exit the stance to be worth their effect.
 Combo cards - want you to be in a specific Stance.
 Finishers - want you to be in a Stance.
 And Stances themselves want you to exit them to refresh the Skill bonus tokens.
 Also if you usually don't want to draw more than one entry/Finisher in a turn.
I can see the contradictions now
#bringbackgladiator
#bringbacklariat
I feel like champ really lacks variety in his deck builds
~~another symptom of the watcher syndrome~~
Watcher at least have calm/wrath and divinity as two distinct builds
I was thinking more Pressure Points vs physical damage
champ doesnt even come close to how boring watcher is they are not comparable
isn't that just because of infinites?
yep
ignoring that then, i think they have a point
also btw Stanek themselves mentioned the term "watcher syndrome" when referring to Champ

Generally speaking Watcher has few decks general, and some more specific ones, but most of the time you end up playing some combo deck.
 That said the problem that  Watcher has is the fact that her numbers are just bigger, especially on upgrades, which means that it is pretty easy to just kill enemies before they can do anything to you.
On the other hand Champ has a problem that it is pretty hard to run a deck that uses 2 Stances at the same time, leading to a third of the card pool being unpickable after first few picks.
Is it now? I usually run mix of both and throw in the ultimate stance whenever the occasion arises which isn't all that often
<Bring It On> nerfed: block and counter reduced from 9 (12) to 8 (10)
